009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.WindowManager;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
015import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
016
017import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
018import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
019import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
020import java.lang.annotation.Target;
021import java.lang.reflect.Field;
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.List;
024
025/**
026 * Utility methods and annotations related to ImageJ's {@link GenericDialog} class.
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/09/14
030 */
031public abstract class DialogUtils {
032
033    private DialogUtils() {}
034
035        /**
036         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' (value) to be shown for following parameter fields. Default label is the
037         * variable name. Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
038         */
039        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
040        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
041        public static @interface DialogLabel {
042                public String value();
043        }
044
045        /**
046         * Annotation to specify the number of digits (value) displayed when showing numeric values in dialogs. This
047         * annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields. Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
048         */
049        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
050        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
051        public static @interface DialogDigits {
052                public int value();
053        }
054
055        /**
056         * Annotation to specify the number of "columns" (value) displayed when showing string items in dialogs. This
057         * annotation has no effect on non-string fields. Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
058         */
059        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
060        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
061        public static @interface DialogStringColumns {
062                public int value();
063        }
064
065
066        /**
067         * Annotation to hide the following parameter field in dialogs. Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle}
068         * fields.
069         */
070        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
071        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
072        public static @interface DialogHide {
073        }
074
075        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
076
077        private static final char NEWLINE = '\n';
078        private static final String SPACE_SEPARATOR = " ";
079        //if text has \n, \r or \t symbols it's better to split by \s+
080        private static final String SPLIT_REGEXP= "\\s+";
081
082        /**
083         * Splits a long string into multiple lines of the specified maximum length and builds a new string with newline
084         * characters separating successive lines. Multiple input strings are first joined into a single sstring using blank
085         * spaces as separators. Intended mainly to format message texts of plugin dialogs. Inspired by:
086         * https://stackoverflow.com/a/21002193
087         *
088         * @param maxLineLength the maximum number oc characters per line
089         * @param strings one ore mor strings
090         * @return a new string with newline characters separating successive lines
091         */
092        public static String splitLines(int maxLineLength, String... strings) {
093                if (strings.length == 0) {
094                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("must pass at least one string");
095                }
096                String input = String.join(SPACE_SEPARATOR, strings);
097                String[] tokens = input.split(SPLIT_REGEXP);
098                StringBuilder output = new StringBuilder(input.length());
099                int lineLen = 0;
100                for (int i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++) {
101                        String word = tokens[i];
102
103                        if (lineLen + (SPACE_SEPARATOR + word).length() > maxLineLength) {
104                                if (i > 0) {
105                                        output.append(NEWLINE);
106                                }
107                                lineLen = 0;
108                        }
109                        if (i < tokens.length - 1 && (lineLen + (word + SPACE_SEPARATOR).length() + tokens[i + 1].length() <=
110                                        maxLineLength)) {
111                                word += SPACE_SEPARATOR;
112                        }
113                        output.append(word);
114                        lineLen += word.length();
115                }
116                return output.toString();
117        }
118
119        /**
120         * Creates a HTML string by formatting the supplied strings as individual text lines separated by {@literal <br>}.
121         * The complete text is wrapped by {@literal <html>...</html>}. Mainly to be used with
122         * {@link GenericDialog#addHelp(String)}.
123         *
124         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
125         * @return a HTML string
126         */
127        public static String makeHtmlString(CharSequence... lines) {
128                return "<html>\n" + String.join("<br>\n", lines) + "\n</html>";
129        }
130
131        /**
132         * Creates a string by formatting the supplied strings as individual text lines separated by newline. Mainly to be
133         * used with {@link GenericDialog#addMessage(String)}.
134         *
135         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
136         * @return a newline-separated string
137         */
138        public static String makeLineSeparatedString(CharSequence... lines) {
139                return String.join("\n", lines);
140        }
141        
142        // ------------ Methods related to ParameterBundle  ------------------
143        
144        static Field[] getDialogFields(ParameterBundle<?> params) {
145                Class<?> clazz = params.getClass();
146                List<Field> dialogFields = new ArrayList<>();
147                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
148                        if (isValidDialogField(f)) {
149                                dialogFields.add(f);
150                        }
151                }
152                return dialogFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
153        }
154
155        /**
156         * Adds all qualified fields of the given {@link ParameterBundle} to the specified {@link GenericDialog} instance,
157         * in the exact order of their definition. Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no
158         * {@link DialogUtils.DialogHide} annotation is present. Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int},
159         * {@code long}, {@code float}, {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
160         *
161         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
162         * @param gd a generic dialog
163         */
164        public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle<?> params, GenericDialog gd) {
165                Field[] dialogFields = getDialogFields(params);         // gets only public fields
166                for (Field f : dialogFields) {
167                        if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
168                                continue;
169                        }
170                        try {
171                                addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
172                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
173                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
174                        }
175                }
176        }
177
178        /**
179         * Retrieves the field values of the specified {@link ParameterBundle} from the {@link GenericDialog} instance. The
180         * {@link ParameterBundle} is modified. Throws an exception if anything goes wrong.
181         *
182         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
183         * @param gd a generic dialog
184         * @return true if successful
185         */
186        public static boolean getFromDialog(ParameterBundle<?> params, GenericDialog gd) {
187                Class<?> clazz = params.getClass();
188                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
189                int errorCount = 0;
190                for (Field f : fields) {
191                        if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
192                                continue;
193                        }
194                        try {
195                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(params, f, gd)) {
196                                        errorCount++;
197                                }
198                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
199                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage()); // TODO: refine exception handling!
200                        }
201                }
202                return (errorCount == 0);
203        }
204
205        /**
206         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to the {@link GenericDialog} instance. The name of
207         * the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item unless a {@link DialogLabel} annotation is present. Allowed
208         * field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code float}, {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
209         *
210         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
211         * @param field some field
212         * @param dialog the dialog
213         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
214         */
215        private static void addFieldToDialog(ParameterBundle<?> params, Field field, GenericDialog dialog)
216                        throws IllegalAccessException {
217                
218                String name = field.getName();
219                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogLabel.class)) {
220                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogLabel.class).value();
221                }
222                
223                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
224                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogDigits.class)) {
225                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogDigits.class).value();
226                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
227                }
228                
229                int stringColumns = 8;
230                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogStringColumns.class)) {
231                        stringColumns = 
232                                        Math.max(stringColumns, field.getAnnotation(DialogStringColumns.class).value());
233                }
234                
235                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
236                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
237                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(params));
238                }
239                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
240                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(params), 0);
241                }
242                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
243                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getLong(params), 0);
244                }
245                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
246                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(params), digits);
247                }
248                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
249                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(params), digits);
250                }
251                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
252                        String str = (String) field.get(params);
253                        dialog.addStringField(name, str, stringColumns);
254                }
255                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
256                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(params));
257                }
258                else {
259                        // ignore this field
260                        //throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
261                }
262        }
263
264        /**
265         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item from the {@link GenericDialog}
266         * instance.
267         *
268         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
269         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object
270         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
271         * @return true if successful
272         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
273         */
274        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
275        private static boolean getFieldFromDialog(ParameterBundle params, Field field, GenericDialog gd)
276                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
277                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
278                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
279                        field.setBoolean(params, gd.getNextBoolean());
280                }
281                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
282                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
283                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
284                                return false;
285                        }
286                        field.setInt(params, (int) val);
287                }
288                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
289                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
290                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
291                                return false;
292                        }
293                        field.setLong(params, (long) val);
294                }
295                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
296                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
297                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
298                                return false;
299                        }
300                        field.setFloat(params, (float) val);
301                }
302                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
303                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
304                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
305                                return false;
306                        }
307                        field.setDouble(params, val);
308                }
309                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
310                        String str = gd.getNextString();
311                        if (str == null) {
312                                return false;
313                        }
314                        field.set(params, str);
315                }
316                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
317                        Enum en = gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
318                        if (en == null) {
319                                return false;
320                        }
321                        field.set(params, en);
322//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
323//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
324                }
325                else {
326                        // ignore this field
327                        // throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
328                }
329                return true;
330        }
331        
332        private static boolean isValidDialogField(Field f) {
333                if (!ParameterBundle.isValidParameterField(f)) {
334                        return false;
335                }
336//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
337//              if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
338//                      return false;
339//              }
340                // accept only certain field types in dialogs:
341                Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
342                return (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || 
343                                clazz == float.class   || clazz == double.class || 
344                                clazz == String.class  || clazz.isEnum());
345        }
346        
347        // various static methods for simple dialogs -------------------------------

353//      public enum DialogResponse {

359//      }
360
361        /**
362         * Opens a simple dialog with the specified title and message that allows only a "Yes" or "Cancel" response.
363         *
364         * @param title the text displayed in the dialog's title bar
365         * @param message the dialog message (may be multiple lines separated by newlines)
366         * @return true if "yes" was selected, false otherwise
367         */
368        @Deprecated
369        public static boolean askYesOrCancel(String title, String message) {
370                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title);
371                gd.addMessage(message);
372                gd.enableYesNoCancel("Yes", "Cancel");
373                gd.hideCancelButton();
374                gd.showDialog();
375                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
376                        return false;
377                }
378                return gd.wasOKed();
379        }
380
381        /**
382         * Opens a very specific dialog asking if the suggested sample image (resource) should be opened and made the active
383         * image. If the answer is YES, the suggested image is opened, otherwise not. This if typically used in the
384         * (otherwise empty) constructor of demo plugins when no (or no suitable) image is currently open.
385         *
386         * @param suggested a sample image ({@link ImageResource})
387         * @return true if user accepted
388         */
389        public static boolean askForSampleImage(ImageResource suggested) {      // TODO: allow multiple sample images?
390                String title = "Open sample image";
391                String message = "No image is currently open.\nUse a sample image?\n";
392                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title);
393                gd.setInsets(0, 0, 0);
394                gd.addMessage(message);
395
396                if (suggested != null) {
397                        gd.setInsets(10, 10, 10);
398                        gd.addImage(suggested.getImageIcon());
399                }
400
401                gd.enableYesNoCancel("Yes", "Cancel");
402                gd.hideCancelButton();
403                gd.showDialog();
404                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
405                        return false;
406                }
407
408                boolean ok = gd.wasOKed();
409                if (ok && suggested != null) {
410                        ImagePlus im = suggested.getImagePlus();
411                        im.show();
412                        WindowManager.setCurrentWindow(im.getWindow());
413                }
414                return ok;
415        }
416        
417        public static boolean askForSampleImage() {
418                return askForSampleImage(null);
419        }
420
